description:
My bf and I were craving pizza after our late night workout so we decided to come here since it was close by and it was opened late. The atmosphere of this place felt kind of empty and cold but that could just be because it was late at night. 

We sat in one of their booths, they were pretty hard...The staff members were nice and the pizza didnt take long to make. The reason why im giving this a 3 stars is i wish the pizza wasn't that oily and the sauce was a bit watery. Overall the dough on the pizza was crunchy. My bf got all cheese and I got mushroom and sausage as my toppings. The sausages were delicious!
author: Samantha W.

description:
You guys ever had wings that were so burned even the box it came in melted?

Giving them 2 stars for opening late night but I would avoid ordering from here unless you got that late night munchies and ABSOLUTELY got no where else to order...
author: Jake Z.

description:
Roma Pizza is absolutely disgusting! It's a shame they are your only late night option /: 

* GREASE
* globs of mozzarella cheese, not even a pizza blend
* pizza was gross and spilling out the sides
* stale fries 
 
Thanks Eat24 for my refund!
author: Tamara R.

description: I wish I could give zero stars. I don't know what idiot made my pasta that I ordered for delivery, but I specified in the instructions that I am vegan and to not use any butter or dairy. I waited over an hour to get my food and when it came, the pasta had cheese all over it. I didn't get to eat dinner and I had to wait another hour for them to fix it. If you dont know the difference between vegan and vegetarian, do NOT work at a restaurant!
author: Emily R.

description: Beautiful little pizzeria, good vibes, and some of the best chicken Parmesan sandwich, and chicken avocado sandwich I have tried. Fries were really great paired with a sandwich of choice. This is my first stop when I head to the bay area.
author: Jay S.

description:
Took 2 hours to get cheese pizza and 2 salads.
I asked for Italian dressing and got thousand island.....super simple order, not sure what the deal was? Pizza was good or maybe I was just starving by the time I got it....
author: Jennifer V.

description: Honestly this Pizza place has been open since I was born it's not the food or the service that brings me here. It's the special place it holds in my heart.
author: Danny Saidy Y.

description:
I liked this place since it's  open till late and the delivery is, mostly on time & pretty fast (and FREE!). BUT, the last time I've ordered a pizza (delicious even it was cold) and a Chicken AVOCADO sandwich, which came WITHOUT AVO! . The fries also were cold as the pizza... Sooooo I've assumed the delivery gal got lost and lost my warm food and the avocado... on the way to my place. 
I'm not giving a bad review to this place, because I understand we can make mistakes. I hope somebody in Roma Pizzeria read this review and found my avocado for my next sandwich (which was... delicious! even without Avocado).
author: Beautytraveler G.

description: flavorless pepperoni and they will only use half a tablespoon of flavorless marinara on a large pizza , all i got was bland pepperoni and cheese and hardly any marinara. garbage ass pizza place, if anybody likes this place dont trust them, try any other pizza place they need to go out of business
author: Luther S.

description:
In my opinion, NO stars! I ordered a pizza from them through Eat24 and the pizza arrived lukewarm. Maybe the driver got lost and drove to Berkeley before coming back to deliver it to my house.  

I chatted with Eat24 customer support and she talked to the restaurant about redelivering my pizza and taking the other pizza back.

Behind my back Eat24 decided to make a backroom deal.  They and Roma agreed to give me a 50% refund.  Meanwhile, I'm oblivious to this...I'm waiting for MY pizza.  After about an hour, I call Roma up, and they let me know that Eat24 and they have agreed that I get a 50% refund.

My God, why did Eat24 tell me the restaurant said the second pizza wouldn't take very long?  I have wasted my time pacing the hallway, waiting for my dinner.

Sooooo, I'm screaming into the phone, calling Eat24 a bunch of morons...and so on.  The rep tells me that I should eat a Snickers bar. 
I told him, don't make fun of ME or I'll call Paypal.

Eat24 forked over the other 50%.  Roma should have know that they owed me a full refund.

I wouldn't ever order from them again.  The pizza was lukewarm. Roma is in my neighborhood--how can this be?  Maybe the pizza went for a ride on the sun roof of the car like a Hot Cheese Momma.

My husband and I had decided not to go out for my birthday and spend a quiet evening together.  Just him, me, and a cheese pizza.
author: Priscilla L.

description: My favorite pizza place. Very good food. The delivery is ok, and the pizza was so tasty.
author: Wanessa F.

description:
Honest review:

*Food*
Nothing against it. Price to taste it is pretty decent. I've had their pizza and their sandwiches and was pleased both times.
Never had their pasta or other stuff though so no opinion hence.

*Service* (delivery only)
So i normally order from here cause i work graveyards and they're one of the few places open at the hour i am craving food. I've ordered from here almost a dozen times in my life. The thing is, over half of my orders always come in late. A few times I've had to contact support through eat24 to figure out what was going on.
Twice before they've also gotten the order wrong. Again, food wasn't bad. It's just in my experience they have a habit of showing up an 30min to an hour (or not at all) after the appointed time.
author: Matthew P.

description:
I've ordered through them a couple times and each time they take FOREVER. Mind you I live about 3 minutes from their shop. If their pizza were actually worth a damn I might be inclined to just hop in my car and take the drive myself but anytime I order from here it's for convenience sake. No longer. After waiting two hours for a pizza at 1am in the morning on a Wednesday night/Thursday morning, I'm done.

CALL ANYONE ELSE BUT THEM.
author: Tommy P.

description:
Ordered delivery.  Food was a half hour late, sides for the entree were wrong and the pizza was so soooo cold.  We would have been better off picking papa Murphy or even little caesars.  Big downer Roma!   Oh yeah, pizza was really bland.

I used the app to demand my tip refunded.  Tip after all, stands for, "to insure promptness".  The app developers need to change their app so we can tip after we get the food so we can tip or not tip appropriately.
author: Ricardo C.

description: Ordered delivery and it arrived early, everything was decent except the garlic bread. DO NOT order it if you like garlic or bread. We received two flat, dry pieces of thick cardboard with no butter, no garlic. Couldn't bite through any of the pieces and just disappointing overall.
author: Noreen S.

description:
So I gave this place two tries and both times I was not really satisfied with the pizza here. The pizza was greasy and it was not on par with other pizzerias that I have been to. I also had a side of spaghetti and I was not happy with that either. I felt like the sauce was a bit watered down. I was surprised that it was also expensive as well.

In terms of service, it was super slow. It took forever for my pizza to be picked up and the manager gave me a bit of attitude about how the place is busy. I would not recommend this place to people.
author: John M.

description: They seem to handle credit card information in a cavalier way. Upon ordering a pizza on the phone, I answered all their questions in order to place a credit card order-the CC number, exp. date and sec. code. When the pizza arrived at my  home, they had entered it as a cash sale. So, when the delivery person called her boss, they wanted all the credit card data again. WAIT...1)what happened to the original data2)why wasn't it entered properly3)they said they threw the info away-did they shred it? They are not careful with my data. When I pressed the boss on any of my concerns with no acceptable answers, he told me, "we have to take the food away!"..in a haughty attitude.  Well, perhaps I'll have to take my business away...and write a review. It was their error. You would think that customer satisfaction would have been their goal.
author: Donald C.

description:
Worst experience ever!!!! 
I ordered 2 cheeseburgers but instead I received 2 things that look like a burrito sandwich burger. The bread was sweaty although the steak was pretty good. I didn't receive any fries that were supposed to come with the burger. 
I believe it's a lying advertising as you can see the ""burgers"" I received don't look anything like the picture. 
I called to protest and the manager told me that I was the one supposed to call Eat24 so they'll change the picture.... WOW. unbelievable. She made me feel like I was working for her. I'm still chocked. You can see below the pictures
author: Greg E.

description:
Worst pizza delivery
Worst pizza quality 
Worst chicken wings 
Don't waste your money in this place 
Worst Customer's Service 
Horrible  Horrible  pizza
author: Margarita L.

description: This pizza place is disgusting. I will never order from here again even if I'm starving. It's so greasy and has no taste. To top it off they took one hour and minutes to make and deliver the disgusting pizza. I only ordered from here because I was told to and Bravo pizza wasn't open. Even Little Caesars Pizza is better no lie!
author: Benito R.

description: Ordered breaded salmon fries with sweet potato and this is what I got. There are a few clumps of breading and these are regular fries. This is the most expensive thing I got and I got totally screwed. Called and spoke to the manager who said he would usually call ahead to let know the error and forgot. Won't ever return . Don't waste your money here. I wish I could give them zero stars. Not even good fries
author: Yi J.

description: So I tried to get some pizza from this place for my wedding day since my homie said it was good but once I came upon this it nearly made my wife to leave me. This pizza was flat out sloppy but it did taste good but god damn the presentation was horrible.
author: Al B.

description: I normally never do reviews on places I order from but this incident has happened to me over 4 times. I ordered the chef salad without cheese (because my 8 year old son is allergic to dairy) every time I order this salad I repeat my order to them at least three times so I know the man that takes my order hears me saying NO CHEESE. I'm not sure what they're doing when they are taking my order but I would strongly recommend them paying attention to their costumers.
author: Celena B.

description:
1.)  Ordered half ravioli and spaghetti plus garlic bread off the eat24 app. The food was estimated to come around 8:23. it came at 8:50 exactly. The driver just handed me my food and left without even double checking if it was the correct order. Boy I guess when they already get their tip they just don't even have a sense of decency. so when I open my food my spaghetti is missing and their is only ravioli. So not was the order late it was also wrong.

2.)  The food I did receive was terrible. the cheese ravioli had horrible ricotta cheese in it that tasted like baby food. The sauce was no good. the garlic bread was dissapointing. 

I was expecting reliable food to satisfy my dinner but it was hugle dissapointing. i am definitely not ordering from this place again.
author: Mohammad A.

description:
Love this place. Roma special with no cheese it's a bomb. Of course I always eat inside. Since I have to go to the City just to get some. 

Chicken Chipotle is a good one too. But I just turn vegetarian so I go for all veggies..... And still it's better than any other places. 

I am not to fan of pastas from a pizza joint. I try to stay away from it.
author: Hector N.

description:
Doubt I'd come back here again. Pizza was 10 mins late despite living only 5 blocks away. Called back to let them know and I got a lousy attitude from cashier. To respond "Its just 10 mins, come on.." as if it wasn't an issue tells me they just don't care. Late is late, is it not? I wasn't trying to get a refund or the tip but I regret bot asking for one now.
No apology was offered initially until my spiel.
author: Brian K.

description: Dannng this pizza is thiccck on the cheese, which I have to say is amazing when at 3am all you want is pizza. I got the meat lovers and it was great. Delivery was exactly on time which I'm glad about because I esas desperately hungry. It wasn't pipping hot and it is definitely on the greasey side, but I didn't mind that. Will be ordering again!
author: Negeen E.

description: If I could give them zero stars, I would. I've been coming here for years and the place has been declining for some time now. Ordered a pizza for pick up, when I went to grab the first slice there was grease that leaked off the pizza and into my hands, almost getting on my clothes. The worst part was the roach I found baked into the pizza. Took the pizza back to get a refund and they want to ask me if I wanted them to bake me another one... no not really. I am beyond disgusted.
author: A B.

description: I love ordering delivery from Roma's. It comes relatively fast and the free delivery and prices make it a frequent order. My favorite is the pesto pizza with only pesto sauce and cheese as well as the chicken caesar salad.
author: Usman P.

description: I used Eat24 to Oder and I order a pizza, and than when I saw there was this black thing, and I was like what is that. I graved it and it was a roach!!!!! I can't believe it!!! Never order here !!!!!
author: Alex M.

description: I ordered the bbq pork ribs entree and it came with spaghetti and soup. It was pretty good. Actually the pork ribs was very flavorful and saucy as it should taste. The soup was a potato soup and was savory and yummy. I think my only complaint was the delivery took so long and it wasn't even during rush hour. I ordered delivery at 12 midnight.
author: Jennifer N.

description: inconsistent. Some days I love it, others I get immediate buyers remorse. The lasagna is good, but way too oily and salty- even when i request light salt. The Cob salad is advertised as having avacado, which they used to put a good amount of it in to the salad. But now I have to search for it. I won't be buying the salads from here anymore, as I can't really justify the cost with the change in quantity. But not bad given the hours they operate, and delivery has always been early or on time.
author: Heather S.

description:
Last two times food was delivered stone cold. Horrible 
2 pizzas extremely greasy and soggy. 
2 cheese burgers over cooked, dry and soggy. 
Chicken wings mushy. 
They will not be getting any more business from our family.
author: Paula M.

description: This place is not bad with their pizza and not bad with their sandwich either.  The guy in the counter is friendly.  I order chicken avacodo sandwich is not bad, or great, is average.  I like the quiet place during weekday at lunch hour.
author: Kitty L.

description:
It's unfortunate that this place has a low rating for various reasons. I'm giving Roma's 4 rather than 3 stars because the veggie options - taste better than Bravo's up the street. 

I know because I purposely ordered a veggie pizza from Bravo to do an A-B test with my friends tonight. I'd never ordered from either place and thought this would be a good excuse and fun way to explore eats with others. Pizza preferences can be really personal but the majority of my group liked Roma's pizza better - thinner crust and more flavor. 

I ordered over the phone and had no issue. In fact I ordered twice for a gathering with friends because I was worried we wouldn't have enough food. I ordered the veggie and Amazon veggie pizza - both medium size - plus a spinach salad. The first pizza was a bit cold but that may have been my bad for picking up a little late? 

Also, they have a special currently where they automatically "upgrade" your pizza size. That said, for the first medium pizza I picked up, it was a medium. The guys who checked me out for the second one, which was upgraded to a large, said they sometimes forget. A nice surprise but if the first one had been a large, I probably wouldn't have ordered a second. So a toss up in terms of "yay" factor.
author: Jung F.

description:
The manager Rynt is a rude pretentious asshole. I had waited 2 hours for my delivery. When I called to check on the status he dismissed me and was very unapologetic. The food is not good enough to wait that long so I cancelled my order.  Kind of upsetting I used to enjoy their sandwiches . However they make bad business decision by hiring managers that suck at customer serovice. If he wasn't so rude I wouldn't have cared so much. Because they hire such rude people I will never spend another penny at this establishment and neither should you. 
F#$& RYNT
author: Sean R.

description:
Without a doubt the best drunk cheese pizza in the neighborhood.

I'm not from New York, but I am from the east coast and have been to New York-style pizzerias, owned by New Yorkers, some of which will get their water shipped in from the city. And because of this background, I have been greatly disappointed by the pizza in California. Even SF doesn't exactly have good pizza.

For good or bad, there are a lot of pizza places in Glen Park/Excelsior/Cayuga Terrace/Sunnyside. Some should definitely be avoided, some only really work in a pinch, and then you have Roma.

My first experience with them was when my friend ordered us after some day drinking a medium cheese and butter bread. It was so good - thick cheese, sweet sauce, and solid crust. The biggest problem is you want to devour the pizza, but as the cheese is so thick you really do need to chew. The drunk hunger dilemma!

However you can only get the cheese. I got the Hawaiian, as it's my favorite type of pizza, and it wasn't as good. I've since gotten the plain cheese a few times and again so good. Might try the pepperoni at least once (heartburn be damned) but the cheese is where it is at.

So if you are in the south side of the City, definitely recommend Roma. Can't speak for their other items, though.

Edit - I've tried the pepperoni. Stick with the thick cheese.
author: Michael C.

description: First experience. Horrible. I waited over a hour and a half for my food. When I opened my order, everything was cold: the fries were soggy, my mozzarella cheese sticks were so cold the cheese didn't even separate, and the pasta was cold. Will not order from them again.
author: Sharon S.

description: I would choose a different pizzeria, took 1 hour 40 minutes to get a pie.
author: Ray P.

description: Solid pizza and open late. Had the jalapeño and pepperoni pizza. Really thought it wasn't going to be good but it was surprisingly good. Worth a try!
author: Antonella H.

description:
I've ordered both pizza delivery on lazy nights and come here after a night of drinking--satisfied on both occasions. 

Their crust is not too thick which I really appreciate. I really like the Hawaiian. One drunken night, my friend and I asked (who I believe to be) the owner which pizza he thought was best, and he actually made us a custom mix of toppings. So bittersweet that I can't remember all of them, as the pizza was seriously delicious.

I ordered a delivery pizza once at about midnight and then decided to take a quick nap while waiting. Unfortunately my phone was on silent, and the delivery man didn't ring the doorbell (he didn't want to wake the neighbors), so it never got delivered. I called the next day to ask about it, and the employee that answered the phone told me he remembered my call and that he would give me a refund. So nice! Thank you!

Definitely my go-to for pizza in Excelsior. (sorry Bravo)
author: Steph D.

description: Late nite for real ness! Got just what I was craving a non healthy greasy cheesey stacked to the max topping pizza slice! Thank you, now im off to bed!!! Good pizza reminds me of golden boy down in north beach.
author: Attic F.

description: Delivery at 1-2 AM was slow despite being a couple of minutes from the restaurant. The wings were good, pizza was super greasy and the cheese kept falling off. Overall it was okay
author: Hugo R.

description:
Our pizza was delicious, but I would never eat in their restaurant again.  If you plan on having their food for dinner, make sure to call for delivery service.  Here are the problems we dealt with the evening that I took my daughter's family there for her birthday dinner.

It was a cold and windy evening.  I sat wiping my nose because it was so friggin cold from the door being cracked wide open.  I was so beside myself that I finally told them if they could please shut the door.  Owner said that it was hot and the cooks needed to keep cool.  That is not my problem, and you're supposed to make your customers warm and happy.  They finally closed the door.

My daughter had to use the restroom.  They had absolutely no toilet paper, and she had to walk into the men's restroom to get some paper towels.  Are you kidding me???

The only time they came to our table is when they took are order and when they placed the food on the table.  Lousy customer and non- waitress service.  They have lost me as a customer.
author: Karen B.

description:
This is the worst pizza I have ever had . if you what a foldable pizza with no crust and no toppings then you've come to the right place 
it maybe one of the most affordable pizza but stay away from this place !
author: Rebecca W.

description:
This could easily be some of the best single slice pizza I've ever gotten. With a variety of toppings (something close to 25 options I believe), I stick with my basic Pepperoni Sausage and Chicken combination. Always get the single slice and a side of fries. Real though to find parking in this area but that's not the reason for the 4-star rating. The only issue this place really has is their customer service, not great but also not good. I think sub-par is a good word for it. 
There's a guy who works here who has glasses and normally wears beanies. He has some great customer service skills, it's the other that lack those skills to make this a 5-star review. 
I understand there are days where it's super busy and it's tough to provide excellent service to all clientele, especially with them being as understaffed as they look. However, even on days where it could be pretty empty and you're the only one in the restaurant, they still rarely help you much. It's normally just "what are you having?" if you order a drink they'll bring it to your table and then once your food arrives, they leave it on your table and walk away. Im not super caring for restaurant employees saying "have a nice meal" once they hand you your food because that's like a nice thing to have but not completely necessary to a good experience. Sometimes your food can be ready but they wait like 5-7 minutes to bring it to your table, maybe they forgot or didn't notice it was ready? i have no clue. 
And when you get water, they never offer if you want more once you finish it. Is that extra of me to say that? 
Overall, i still come here for good food, because that it is. Customer Service is subpar, unless the gentleman with the glasses and beanies is there. Try it out, trust fam!
author: Arturo A.

description: Ordered for delivery.. came more than an hour, the sweet crepe tasted like over used oil. Pizza was so greasy. Never again.
author: Jojo P.

description: This used to be our go-to place but after a while of not ordering take out we have had a few late night projects and needed something easy so we thought "Roma! For old times sake" and they have taken a SERIOUS nose dive. Just garbage food now :( What a shame
author: Kira H.

description: It's a cool spot that's open late and they have beer. Our first time in sf and glad to find this place. Not much open after 12
author: Josh P.

description: I wouldn't even give them a star honestly. Very poor customer service, on top of that they didn't want to hear me out. Lastly they didn't even go to the right address. When I called they where impatient and disrespectful.
author: Jaquelin Z.

description: Ordered a small pepperoni pizza with pineapple. First off, there was no pizza sauce so it was basically cheese in bread. Secondly, there was about a pound of cheese sitting on top of pizza bread. There were maybe 10 slices of pepperoni and maybe 12 small pieces of pineapple. I asked for a little more pineapple since it was almost all cheese. They said they would charge me extra. This place is just a corner restaurant in a sketchy area that's open till 4am. I don't recommend it. I'd go to the Peruvian restaurant down the street if I had the choice again....or just go to Taco Bell.
author: Mish A.

description: Basically took almost 2 hours to get my pizza and wings. I live 5 blocks away.. driver gave me crepe instead of wings and had to wait even longer for those. Most poor experience ever. Only gave the extra star because driver let me keep the cold stale crepe and pizza was decent
author: Alex V.

description:
So I ordered from Roma in the past and usually they're fine. Except tonight. I found a bug in my salad. A big bug. I got a refund through Eat24, but I am so disgusted with the realization that their kitchen is probably dirty as heck (read the other reviews people had similar experiences) that I will probably never order from here again.

Stay away for the sake of your health.
author: Bernice W.

description: I am really disappointed with the food I got. The pizza was covered in grease and the crust was burnt. The wings were really just steamed wings with a drizzle of the sauce. Honestly I just covered it with the ranch dressing offered because it did not taste good. If I had known about the pizza I was getting I would had just went to Costco instead. It is not worth the wait.
author: Becky L.

description:
I came here spontaneously for pizza. Parking can be difficult with street parking in the neighborhood with some narrow streets. Mission street is very busy with traffic. I came here in the weekday early afternoon and I was the only person there but there were phone calls coming in with orders. I saw one delivery guy coming in and picking up pizzas.

When you come here for food, be sure to ask for the take out menu because on the back has coupons. And we all love coupons!! Yah!! :-) This is a nice small neighborhood pizza place. 

I decided to order the Meat Lovers pizza that has sausage, pepperoni, salami and beef. I saw the pizza guy making it and put it in the oven. It is always fun seeing the pizza being made. It took about 15 minutes to make it and during that time I was watching other pizzas being made. There's a lot of pizza combinations I never heard of before that sounds interesting like the Bad Boy that has chicken, mushrooms, onion, beef, linguica, sausage, bacon and pepperoni or the Sunday Special with toppings like white sauce, Tuna, shrimp, clams, garlic and green olives.

I like how the crust is light and not too heavy with dough. The pizza had very light layer of tomato sauce which was fine with me that seemed non existent to me when I was eating it. I am not a fan of tomatoes so this was  a plus for me. I enjoyed the crust, not hard or too chewy and was just right. The ingredients I thought were good portion size to the medium pizza. The pizza was flavorable with the toppings. The cashier was nice and thanked me for coming here.

If I happen to get lost in this neighborhood again or feel like an adventure, I would come back and be brave to try the Bad Boy combination pizza. 

Every now and again, don't we need either a bad boy or bad girl in our life to spice things up a bit? ;-) I am just joking. Sorry I forgot to check in, but I was here though. :-)
author: Priscilla L.

description: I've always ordered sandwiches, was a little hesitating about ordering something else, but this time this deserves five stars! Whole barbecue chicken, they added salad, spaghetti and garlic bread!
author: Edwin M.

description: No stars if i could 45 min to 1 hr wait. 1 hr and 15 minutes still no pizza. I called ten more minutes after that passed I called to just cancel
author: M C.

description:
They do a lot of things right. 

I'm from Southern New England and lived in Providence RI for 3 years before moving West. Providence has some of the best pizza. You can blindly pick a random pizza joint and know that you're going to get something better than most places in the Bay Area. Yes SF has its niche market for pizza, but I'm talking classic pizza, $12 a pie,...hold the kale. 

Roma doesn't do the typical rush pizza where the cheese is barely melted. If anything they slightly overcook, which I prefer over undercooked. The pepperoni is curled up and crisp like bacon.

SLA/ESD: I've never had them take too long and typically they arrive in less than an hour (i'm near CCSF Phelan)

The NY Steak comes green peppers and onions with a side dish of spaghetti and meat marinara which is awesome (unless you choose rice. not sure if there's any sauce if you choose rice). Also comes with a small salad with dressing of your choice and a small piece of bread. 

The Chicken Parm Sandwich could use slightly more marinara but overall, a great sandwich. Bread is not hard, good cheese, good chicken filet.
author: Dan A.

description:
Best pizza I have ever tried! After eating here I won't go anywhere else for pizza , is not a fancy plaze by any means but the pizza really make up for the lack of decor, I do want to point out the service is always great.
Give them a try in you are in the area, you won't regret it :)
author: Paula I.

description: The pizza here is very unappetizing and flavorless. It was completely covered in grease. The cheese and toppings do not stay on from how soggy it is. My pizza also had a hair in it. Never again will we get pizza from here, and I would recommend others to skip this place also.
author: Lily V.

description: Pizza is ok. I waited 1 hour to get my order delivered, that's not bad. Use them when I'm very lazy
author: Denny D.

description:
My SO and I have ordered from Roma's for YEARS... at least once a week, going on nearly a decade. While something has definitely changed in the last couple months (different cook?), tonight's racist experience was inexcusable.

Called to place our order for delivery as usual, but it was an unknown man, that we've never ordered from before, that answered. We inquired about a certain aspect to our order that we always get, and the newbie literally asked the owner, saying in Portuguese, "there's some stupid American on the phone asking for..."

We hung up the phone. This 'Americano' happens to be Latin, you jerk. Domingo, your offensive employees with be the death of your business: if your employees are going to racist, at least put the phone on mute. Shame on him, shame on you.
author: N M.

description: The food here is ok nothing super fantastic. The major problem is when you order delivery. I have ordered delivery 3 times and every time it has taken at least an hour and a half. Tonight I canceled my order with eat24 after an hour and 45 minutes and still no food. If you can't deliver in an hour at least let your customers know.
author: Eric G.

description:
I've written probably 3 reviews in the past 10 years. 

You know how they say even when pizza is bad, it's good? This place throws that orthodoxy out of the window. After two slices (I was full) I looked at my pizza, pretty depressed when my girlfriend put her crusts down. And I did something I didn't know you could do, but grabbed the crusts and ate them instead, thinking "man, the crusts are the best part of this pizza". I think that says it all. Also they use that super shitty rubber cheese that doesn't even adhere to the dough and if you don't cradle the slice to your plate gravity will shear that goop right off your triangle bread.

Fair warning.
author: Harris R.

description:
Over the course of the last three years I've ordered food from Roma Pizzeria intermittently and there was a few times I walked into the store to buy something.

Every time the owner was cheerful, nice, had a smile on his face and I finally decided to write a review about it (should've done it a long time ago but not really a yelper) to give them five stars.  I just ordered pizza tonight and the man on the phone was very cool about adding cheese to my pizza which I forgot to do on Grubhub.

In this city, there isn't a lot of upbeat customer service. You should give credit where credit is due. 

Thank you Roma Pizzeria for your wonderful customer service. It is appreciated. :)
author: Ms C.

description: Ordered food from here. An hour after it was scheduled to arrive it still hadn't shown up so I gave the restaurant a call. The person who answered the phone told me matter of factly that they did not start the order yet and asked if l wanted them to start it now. Did not apologize. I placed the order at midnight so at this point it's 2 in the morning. I had to cancel
author: Ivan C.

description:
Affordable, free-delivery (but I always tip!)

Two times I've ordered from them. Once at like 1am in the morning for their delivery. Another recent one was a regular work hours. For two people, we're pretty satisfied with the quality, amount of food, and getting to fill our tummies under $30.

We usually order:
Lasagna, Parmesan Cheese Dinner/Lunch Plate (each plate includes options with Spaghetti, salad, and soup. Get it for the bang of your buck! ) 
AND MUST TRY THEIR GARLIC FRIES!!!!!!

We've tried Mozerella Cheese & Garlic Bread, but I don't think it's worth it for the price. :/
author: Angela L.

description: I placed an online order and it supposed to be 26$ total but they charged me 32$!!! When I asked they say that some toppings are supposed to be charged double in the website!! That's not my problem you didn't change your online price!!! Thieves
author: Skander B.

description: I got a cheeseburger, fries, and garlic bread with cheese for delivery awhile back. It's really different. For starters, the cheeseburger is not on regular bread. I saw it and thought it was a sandwich until I looked closer inside. Wasn't what I expected at all, but it still tasted really good, especially with the mayo they gave. Fries were great and there were a lot! The only unsure feeling I had about was the garlic bread. It looks nice but tasted a little bland. I popped it in the microwave, tasted a bit better. Overall, the "burger" here is different but I still recommend it since it's filling and tastes real good. Fries and portions are great. If I was around I'd order again, except the garlic cheese bread.
author: Bel H.

description:
Love their pizza. Always our late night go to pizza joint! Never had any problems with the owner or staff - they're all super sweet. 

Check them out if you're in the area - you won't regret it! :)
author: Lisa N.

description: My favorite go to pizza place!  I ordered a few times times from this place and it always hits the spot.  I've never been disappointed.  I'm normally a pizza snob but this place has the most delicious authentic real Italian pizza in the neighborhood.  I give this place 2 thumbs up!!!
author: MaryJane D.

description: Everything I've tried has been pretty good, I order from here regularly. Cheap, delicious food!
author: Joshua P.

description: I've only tried their veggie slices, but I've had a lot of them they're so good every time! The style is on the thick side, but the crust is always crispy and perfectly cooked. Never soggy and just the right amount of cheese and veggies. Not artisanal designer pizza. Solid old-school. Reasonably priced and generous size. Open late!
author: J J.

description: Truly disappointed.  The delivery time was way longer than stated.  The pizza was soggy and Really greasy.  We were taking paper towels to "de-grease" it.  The topping were ok.  That's why they get a 2 star.  I could not even tell if there was pizza sauce on this pizza.  Overall it lacked flavor and the crust was not good.  I really hate spending money on bad food.  It wont happen to me again for this place.  I only went to this place because some friends recommended it.
author: Rich K.

description:
I order delivery I was at a bar it was good to get food in my system but not a place I would go to regularly.

I can say that their wings were good though!.
author: Brian N.

description: Niece got hungry so order some pizza for us to eat. The ordering was fast however I understand that it takes a while to cook those pizza, however my pizza crust some was burned. And my niece keeps saying the sauce is "hot" order the medium pizza w pepperoni and pineapple for $19.50 and gave the lady $23 $3 for tips. I love how there delivery is free and open very late .  It's has a lot cheese which is good for cheese lovers myself but it was hard to get the pizza out due to all the cheese and some was stuck at the bottom. Thanks again
author: Jennifer L.

description: I consider myself well versed in the realm of pizza & as for Roma Pizzeria goes it was as average as can be. I ordered a pepperoni pizza and was excited to try out a new place & hopefully find my new favorite pizza place... But sadly i was let down. The pizza itself was very greasy & lacked any flavor. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. This pizza would best be suited as a dollar slice pizzeria.
author: Fernando G.

description: Called Roma pizza more than three times for update an order for over and hour late for delivery. Put me on hold for a duration of a time. I called back to complain and they told me they delivered my pizza to someone who signed for it. They delivered the pizza to the wrong place. But I corrected them to say when I usually get an order the driver calls me when they arrive at my complex. But the RESTAURANT never called me but gave the order to the wrong complex. And they said they are going to send me a new pizza with no charge and it is still not here. Roma pizza never order from them.
author: Jan C.

description: Amazing little pizza place! I ordered the Athens slice and it was bommmmmbbbb. This is a great restaurant to stop by when you get that random pizza craving (so pretty much always?!). I wish I had known about this place when I first moved to the city. Definitely coming back again!!
author: Christine M.

description: The bad reviews here seem to be delivery related. My gated community is always a problem for delivery so I dine in. The neighborhood is challenging but parking has never been an issue for me. The dining room is reflective of the neighborhood but that means no need to change out of your house clothes. They have bottle beer, the tap beer is always broken. The grilled sandwiches are great and I really prefer their pizza over the others in the neighborhood. Never an issue with cheap ingredients. Generous portions. The guy in charge has always been accommodating.
author: Stanley J.

description: I have had no problem ordering from this restaurant in past experiences but on my most recent experience I found a cockroach run out of my pizza box and didn't feel like should eat the pizza after this had happened. Otherwise the food was great in the past but I don't think I'll be ordering here for a while.
author: Maria N.

description:
to start, the delivery driver fucked up and gave me the wrong pizza. i ordered a small pepperoni/jalapeño/artichoke heart/gorgonzola pizza. instead got a medium sausage/green pepper/mushroom/jalapeño pizza, which has me questioning some people's personal choice of toppings but I digress. questionable pizza was hot, they're pretty liberal with toppings and about an average wait time (1 hour) for (free) delivery. bright side, the delivery driver realized he had fucked up and brought the RIGHT pizza. but not until after i had already succumbed to my hanger, succumbed to the loss of not getting what i ordered at close to midnight and eating a slice of the sad* pizza. :( points given for trying to reconcile, but a star less for not having my shit together to begin with.

*note: sad pizza for being wrong, not to be taken from the cheesy goodness that is pizza itself.
author: Tiffany S.

description: I gave Roma a great review last week. But today my  son ordered a cornish hen w/2 sides of spaghetti (bland no flavor), as you can see from the pictures this is the garbage we received. This is completely unacceptable.  A hard, brown, lukewarm week old looking small chicken passed off as a Cornish hen. I'm so disappointed, how disrespectful can they be. When my son called to complain they gave him attitude instead of an apology. When he asked for them to pick up their bird and change his order, they had the nerve to say that there will be an additionl charge of two dollars. They screwed and delivered a week old refrigerated, beef jerky looking dirty bird and they want to add an additional fee, really! I know that this chicken was at least in the fridge for a week. When I touched the leg it felt like beef jerky. Roma please respect your customers! You guys are bringing bad karma to your business when you treat your customers with this kind of disrespect! Did they really try to pass an old small chicken for a cornish hen...wow! I will change my review when I get a call with an apology and if this review is still up it's because they haven't. I will never buy food from here again!
author: Maria L.

description: I'm was really fond of this place until today! I called in to order pizza and wings per usual.. Unfortunately I've been waiting for my pizza for 2 HOURS!! Not to mention the lack of concern from the person answering the phone and taking orders. I called them twice and he wasn't able to provide me with any information beside the fact that "my pizza was on the way." Then when I called to cancel, he asks me my address then goes "what!?" Horrible customer service from somewhere I actually liked. I've never had a problem with them until today. At the very least, they could've comped us our pizza. I'm definitely sticking to Pizza Express from here on out!
author: Jasmine C.

description:
So. This is a review about their delivery service. I've never dined in the actual restaurant before. It is so crazy how one horrible experience can just turn me off from a place. I have ordered from this restaurant many times. I've moved a couple of times in the San Francisco and to Daly City and I order from them because they deliver and they have dessert crepes. 

However... today, just now... I received not only two disgustingly soggy crepes and a dingy portion of the Caprese Salad. But... the delivery was a bit over an hour and the driver kept calling me telling me where he was but when I would give him explicit directions on where to turn or where to meet me he would move or try to find his own way here! It was very frustrating! I fricken live here! Listen to my directions! 

I'm hungry, standing out in the fog and cold waiting for the delivery driver to find my place. I've even had them deliver to this address before. I get their delivery all of the time. But this was just so frustrating and annoying. I never want this to happen again. Next time I want crepes I'll get my lazy butt out the door and drive to Crepe Vine or something. 

Bottom line, my suggestion to you is, don't order delivery from them.
author: Laura B.

description:
Horrible pizza
Garlic bread is good tho
But really this place is crap and selling dreams, my pizza was like a soup and every slice i pulled off either riped in half or just had to cheese on it, besides that, NASTY NASTY NASTY
author: E M.

description: Something bad has happened to this place.  They used to be very good, fast and accurate.  Now every time I order from Eat24, the order comes wrong.   Eat24 tried to call them to let them know and they just hung up on them.  I tried to order from them 2 nights ago and I received a text that they closed early.  Not sure if management has changed but I don't think I'll be ordering from them again.
author: vanessa a.

description: 1 hr delivery. pizza not hot when it came. taste is ok but not delicious. frozen digiorno can better.
author: Tata A.

description:
It took an hour and a half for my delivery order to arrive and it wasn't even busy hours. Called to the restaurant they didn't even apologize. 

Ordered a strawberry crepe but got a mango one. Garlic cheesy bread was recommended here but I feel like it's nothing special. Everyone can make something like that at home. 

Very disappointed.
author: Karrine L.

description:
I saw the employees interacting when I went there and I just don't trust them. Except for the guy who was wearing glasses and making deliveries. He was a young guy who was minding his own business doing his job.
I also must add, there was BLOOD IN THE WOMENS RESTROOM FLOOR. Seriously? Can't clean that?
author: Ana R.

description: I've been coming here for about 3-4 years now.. I usually just get a slice of pineapple pepperoni pizza when I feel like pizza.. It's pretty good, you could get a slice & a beverage for about 5,6$ here... & I love their crepes & all their pastas are the best  ... I also love that they are open so late at night for us night owls... & The owners very sweet & you can tell he loves his restaurant..
author: Bottom B.

description: For a first time experience, love this place.  Their pizza was superb, melted cheesy goodness :)
author: Pam S.

description:
Can't really speak about their food. It never came.  When we called in the order taker put the driver on the phone who seemed to want to win some argument. He claimed that he knocked on our door and rang the bell but we were in the room right by the door and never heard him knock, ring or even come up the stairs like we hear everyone else. He claimed he tried phoning us five times but we saw no missed calls in our caller ID log.
The order taker said that we had to get our refund from grub hub and so, we will.
We won't be ordering from this place again.
author: Robert F.

description: I go in to order a pizza the night of 12/27 after working a long 13hr shift. After having enjoyed the pizza, though slightly above average last time I came here, I figured I'd go again. I walk in and stand directly in front of the register for 5+ minutes and the girl at the register doesn't look up ONCE from her phone to take my order. That's a horrible image and extremely unprofessional. She had her head and everything tucked behind the computer and the cook didn't bother to tell her I was waiting. Take your job seriously and respect the business! Manager take note of your employees behavior! Two stars only because the pizza was ok last time.
author: Paul M.

description: This place has one of the best costumer service ever, very friendly, nice and happy to serve you. I lived one block away from this restaurant, i was happy that they are open very late. I recommend this restaurant for everyone.  My favorite here is their pizza they are cook really good and their mango crepe which i order every time i come here.... u rock Roma Pizzeria
author: Rv Andrew V.

description: Yoh! I love pizza and no pizza has ever ever let  me down till this day. I will never ever order pizza from here again. It was a disappointment! Seriously.
author: Angelica E.

description:
As we have recently switches to Roma Pizza, we have been happy ao far.  The person answering the phone is usually very polite and helpful. 

The Pizza so far has been what you should expect.  Loaded with items ordered and hot.  Have been very pleased as we do not miss the burned,  cheese-less Pizza from Little Joe's Pizza.  A place we frequented for nearly 30 years.  Bye bye Joe's hello ROMA.
author: Peter S.

description:
So far we've ordered twice from Roma and been satisfied both times. The pizza is above average, good toppings, friendly and fast delivery service. The prices are totally reasonable, and they give you 10% off orders of $15 or more, which is basically every order.

Tonight I ordered a pizza with green onions. They mistakenly put green olives on it, which I do not eat, but they re-delivered another pizza with the correct toppings in 30 minutes! Maybe I'm a jaded delivery customer, but that is pretty great service. They're quickly becoming my go-to delivery pizza place.
author: Ian N.

description:
I don't live in San Francisco, but I have to go here once a month for an ongoing job. When I go, I stay at "The Alpine Inn & Suites" and order delivery from this place for myself and my co-workers... we found one of their flyers at the front desk of the Inn.

Every time I've ordered, the order was taken quickly and efficiently without a problem. Never a mistake, never a glich. We've ordered just pizza, and also pizza with salad, garlic bread and drinks. And it's absolutely delicious each and every time.

When we come into the city, we are in a big truck & trailer combination that can't go driving around to look for food... it's nice to know that this dependable place is just a phone call away.

Wish they delivered to Anaheim where we live... I would be on the phone wih them now!
author: Eugene S.

description: Chicken Alfredo, Chicken Avocado Sandwich are so tasty! Fries are...meh and so is the Tiramisu cake. The House salad is very fresh. First time eating at this place and it was great. I can't wait to try their Pizza next time! GrubHub delivery at 12am.
author: Marie M.

description: Ordered a large pepperoni pizza from here and when I received it, it was neon orange from all of the grease and was soaked. I had to use half of my paper towel roll to get some of the grease off . Asked for paper plates and didn't receive them the pizza was cold , greasy, and soggy. Never ordering from here again.
author: Leana A.

description:
I made an order through Eat 24 my order delivery time was confirmed to be 45 Mins. However the delivery took an hour and half and when it delivered the food was cold as HELL !!!! 
I would never order food from this place again.
author: Emanula M.

description: Roma is usually amazing. Seriously they are part if the reason I'm a fatty. I usually talk about you guys with pride, referring you to friends and family. My last 4 orders have been horribly wrong. My pesto crepe which was supposed to have scrambled egg had over cooked hard boiled egg in it. It had dried egg yolks in the crepe smeared in with pesto and cheese and left the whites on the outside next to the crepe. I felt dumb for eating it. That was a really non sensible way to make a substitution. What were you thinking?  My order was also missing 2 carrot cakes. Im a very frequent customer of you guys usually. You have amazing food and ingredients and your flavors meld so well but execution and even presentation is not where it should be for quality food like this. I'm a chef who has so much experience in Italian joints like this. Wants some one to come help you turn this around? Call me 415 312 0645. My name is John
author: John B.

description:
I was really craving pizza tonight and checked out the local pizza places near me that delivered.  Roma's seemed like a decent chocie, and after looking through the menu I decided on a vegetarian crepe and garlic bread. Funny how the crepe won me over. 

The order took  almost an hour and my food was cold. Straight up no heat to it. The taste is delicious,  but it was very upsetting to wait so long and get a cold meal. 

I had a very long work week, and have suffered a sprained ankle just a few days ago, so the last thing I wanted to do was turn on the oven and wait even more to eat. Plus,  the point of ordering delivery is so you don't have to do anything for your meal. I'm very disappointed,  especially since it looks like it could be delicious. 

I would POSSIBLY consider eating in the restaurant,  but I don't believe I'll ever be ordering delivery from here again.
author: Alicia F.

description: This place has terrible service. First of all it took me almost 2 hours to get my pizza when grub hub said it should only take about an hour. I realize that they're really busy at night time but still they could've at least called me with an update. Then when I got my pizza and opened the box it wasn't even the correct order. It was someone else's pizza. When I called before I got my pizza to ask where was all the woman said was that it would be here in a few minutes. But it was really like another 15. And then I tried to call them back and tell him that they gave me the wrong pizza and I was on hold for like forever. So ridiculous.
author: Ariel H.

description:
was super hungry trying to find a place in mission at 7 or 8 pm! And stumbled upon this place while heading toward another restaurant. I was hungry so i just wanted to settle at an ok place and just eat. Ordered a large size meat lover pizza and garlic fries. Both the pizza and garlic fries were freshly made, it was delicious!! 

They may have gotten a lot of bad reviews because they make their pizza after you order and i realize a lot of the times its delivery instead of eatting it there. Therefore, it may take longer since it takes time to make it and deliver it and it may not be as fresh as eatting it there.
author: Angela L.

description: Ordered again and it was Amazing ! The Cheese Sauce the crust , toppings is perfect ! We got a half pineapple pepperoni pizza and sausage ! Hands down my pizza go to spot !
author: Erik R.

description: They took 2 hours to deliver the pizza. Didn't knock on the door nor call the number that was requested upon arrival. Went to the door to find the driver standing outside of the car with the pizza... Just standing there. Pizza was cold... Forgot the wings & one of the toppings on the pizza. So he went back to grab the hot wings which tasted horrible because they serve them in a plastic container -Which sweats. Every wing was damp & soggy. Nasty food & horrible service... & we waited 2 hours for this.
author: Millz S.

description: I think you just have to know what to order here. In the past, I ordered pizza and pasta, which were average. Tonight, I ordered the meat lasagne with marinara. It was really good. It's greasy because the meat is rich and there's tons of melty cheese (all good things in my book!) so I just poured out the excess grease before eating. For around $10 to boot. Definitely beats out Sausage Factory's $18 option which was my go-to. Delivery minimum from Roma is low too ($13, I think).
author: Mika S.

description: This is the best place if ur choice is Italian food and the delivery service it's great!!!!
author: Cynthia G.

description: An hour and a half for a guaranteed 45min delivery which was a freaking salad, and fries... Called and cancelled my order they were at my door 10mins later and refused to leave without giving me the food.... Never ordering from them again.... That is ridiculous!
author: Ariona E.

description: Horrible service. Wish I could give ZERO STARS!!! Ordered food at 4:17. First they said estimated delivery is 5:55-6:05.  Then it changed to 6:09. I called store at 6:11. Thy said food was on the way. It's now 6:20. No food yet. Over 2 hours ago I ordered this for me and my two kids. We are all starving. And now 6:21 still no food. I don't care how it tastes. If you can't get the food to your family in time for dinners. (OVER two hour wait) IT REALLY DOESNT MATTER HOW IT TASTES!!!! I will never order from them again. I usually don't write reviews. But if I can save someone else from this then I should. Don't order from this joke of a restaurant. Now 6:25 Still no food.
author: Chris S.

description: First Yelp review. Had a very early morning today. Came home and wanted some thing quick and delivered. Roma came through big time. Food was great, hot, and on time. The chicken pesto sandwich was exactly what I was looking for. I'll be back
author: Sean S.

description: me and my girl always eat here late at night and we always felt welcome-- food is great and service too.. would definitely recommend this place to anyone craving for pizza at 10pm :)
author: Mike M.

description:
This was our pizza joint when we lived in the city and it was always delivered hot, fresh and on time..

We always ordered an xlg half Roma special and half chicken- mushrooms-garlic with pesto sauce. It is absolutely yummylicious & so damn cheesylicious..

We now live out in the valley where there is no cheesylicious pizza that comes close to Roma's.  Every time we have pizza from elsewhere, we get nostalgic about Roma's.  So whenever we head out to the city for a visit, we always plan to pick up a pizza from there.
author: LC B.

description:
The interior of Roma really scares me, at least in the pictures. Seriously Roma -- your restaurant looks like a Dairy Queen on the wrong side of the tracks in a bad suburb.

I guess it's a good thing I've never set foot in here. Boyfriend and I have ordered delivery here for more than a year. It's about 4 miles away from our apartment -- a decent trek in San Francisco! -- but they still arrive in under an hour. 

And we love the food. Roma's chicken avocado sandwiches are so big, with lots of chicken, melted cheese, and, of course, avocado. Jalapeno poppers taste like they came from a Safeway freezer, but they get the job done. We always get 2 meatballs for $1 simply because they're on the menu.

I recommend getting delivery here when you're feeling gluttonous. While Roma food is tasty, it never digests that well. I try to limit myself to ordering once monthly because of this. Also because I'm sure this restaurant thinks we're weird, being probably their only regulars living in the Sunset District.
author: David S.

description:
0 stars if i could,
 I clearly asked for alot of ranch, napkins, and a soda along with my large pizza and buffalo 12pc chicken.
Mind you, i only recieved pizza, a crumbled box with hotwings 12pc. No napkins, and a ranch. And no soda.
author: Alex P.

description:
I stopped by this afternoon for a slice of cheese pizza for the first time, and its fairly good :) Not amazing hence 4 stars, but its definitely made fresh. Plus, the manager was there and he never saw me before, so he gave me a discount: $3.00 for the slice! 

Unfortunately, the pizza took a while, because they didn't have cheese ready. But I had time, and it was nice to see them actually bake the pizza in front of me :) I had a nice conversation with the manager, and over a very good experience. The place is fairly clean and the restaurant is open till 2AM. I'll be back =D
author: Anna L.

description: THE FOOD ISNT TERRIBLE. I've eaten food from here quite a few times and theyre usually late but who can complain at 2 AM? However, last night we ordered sandwiches, and chaos ensued. Mine was completely charred on one side. I was tipsy and tired so i went to bed. Luckily. My girlfriend had a chicken pesto sandwich, which she thought was decent. Today she woke up and was incredibly sick. Normally I dont rush to judgement because it is hard to tell what food caused the problem. However, we were at hardly strictly bluegrass all day and this was all she had to eat. She got so sick that she had to go to the hospital for fluids. I called grubhub and the restaurant, and they refused to refund my money. What terrible buainess practices...does anyone know the health departments number?
author: Daniel M.

description: Came in today around noonish or so and had a small pizza. Great crust, and even better toppings. I love how they have Gorgonzola as a topping. I got a combination I really enjoy, Gorgonzola, sausage, artichokes, roasted red pepper. It was delicious and perfectly cooked but the juices from the artichoke hearts were every where which made it impossible to eat by picking up the slice. Might I suggest pre baking them and storing them in light olive oil it will be less runny and wet that way. The pre bake should make the juices release a bit and the olive oil will keep them from being all dried out.
author: John B.

description: Food is good, but the forgot my Mexican coke on the delivery. They is 2 dollars down the drain.
author: Blake D.

description: This is not the first time I've gotten this pizza and I love Roma but this is not the first time I have ordered and when it's gotten here it's been either all soupy or cheese stuck to the side of the box, it's  unacceptable to pay so much and not get the delicious pizza I was expecting I hope they get their game back together
author: Jose T.

description: The lady who served us was a little moody and I would only give the pizza a so-so rating. Crust was soft and better than expected. The chicken and zucchini we created was actually SO good!! Convenient hours and easy parking - definitely a place to check out if you aren't cooking or already planning on a better restaurant.
author: Christopher F.

description: ordered a pasta and it arrived in one and a half hour, I texted several times to eat24 and restaurant kept lying on time. The worst part is they forgot my drink "again" I have ordered 4 times total to this business but they forgot 3 times out of 4, what a joke. Never gonna order from this business again, food is not even good.
author: Kido K.

description: This place is good for that late night pizza craving....delivery service was okay. Pizza probably about a 7 1/2 out of 10. I ordered the meatlovers pizza, I just couldnt keep the toppings on the pizza.
author: AVERY R.

description: Pretty good pizza. I felt bad the first time because i didn't know i selected tip with cash when i had no cash on hand, but the delivery was quick, maybe around 30minutes. Gonna continue ordering from here for a while
author: Elton C.

description: I love this place, they have the best food and a amazing owner "Domingo's". I highly recommend going to this place. I love this place!!!!
author: Rafaella P.

description: Ordered some pizza on Fathers Day with the family. 90 min later the food still isn't here. With a 20% tip. Thanks guys.
author: Paul G.

description: Great!! Pizza and the staff is nice. Open late so if tou are craving late snacks  stop by ..
author: Gigi H.

description: Ordered late night medium hawaiian... 20 min from the time I pressed 'Send' to the time it arrived at my doorstep, via Eat24. No joke.
author: Ariel Y.

description: By far the best pizzeria! Open until 2:00am on the weekends. I've been going to this pkace since I was 4 years old. Over 30 years later and nothing hasn't changed except for the owners. Brought my wife and teenage daughters in for their first time on New Years Day 2014. I couldn't believe both my daughters ate a large cheese pizza and a medium pepperoni pizza in one sitting. My brother who lives in Maryland flew out here one year for a vacation and first place he wanted to go to as soon as he got off the plane was Roma's. For those people that gave this place bad reviews must either be picky or juat too used to places like Round Table or Dominos. This place WILL forever always bee ACES in my book.
author: P N.

description: We constantly order this at work for lunch and the pizza always arrives within the estimated time. Its cheesy with not a lot of grease that other pizza joints have, Only downfall is sometimes there is a communication issue between the person on the phone and the delivery driver where he will get to out building but wont know what suite we are in even though the person on the phone is told. Other then that Great Pizza, Great Price, and On Time Delivery!
author: Robert G.

description: Frozen cardboard. Potentially the most disgusting food I've had... ever. I'd rather lick the freezer burn off of my roommates moldy tater tots.
author: ray r.

description: Our fave pizza delivery spot! We always get xl pepperoni and mushroom pizza....if we are feeling piggy, we also get gus' favorite (seafood pasta) or shrimp alfredo. Their desserts are good too. the delivery folks are also really nice...my husband says the brazilian delivery girl is "crackin"
author: Joy R.

description: I don't know why this place had such low ratings! The good is fantastic and gives you a very home style Italian cooking! We had veal scallopini, seafood pasta, and ravioli. All 3 dishes were great and we well definitely be back again!
author: Man L.

description: I really want to give them a good review, but they've gotten my order wrong multiple times.
author: Max R.

description: its 12am on a thursday night. I ordered online through eat24 and at first the girl on the phone called and made sure what i wanted on the pizza. (pepperoni and extra bacon) how thoughtful! the jalapeno poppers were amazing cream filled!! so good. the buffalo wings were delicious except for the garnish i ate the carrots and the celery the lettuce is just unnecessary lol. ANYWAYS it all came is less than 30 minutes. Im super picky about pizza and this pizza was perfectly cooked. I love you Roma!! My mom loves this place. im going to keep ordering. :D
author: Betsy E.

description:
Sooooo, when a delivery from a local pizza spot had an epic fail in delivering me a simple cheeseburger, I reached out and found Roma. After waiting and hour and forty minutes i canceled my order and placed an online order with these guys. 

A short 45mins ( if even!) later the bell rang and my cheeseburger was in my hands. The fries cost and extra $1.50, but if you want fries, they are what they are. As for the burger, it was huge and good! No choice on cheese, it's  mozzerella and comes with the fixins. But what makes this burger good is the pizza dough like bread they serve it on. A-MAZING!! and unique to say the least. It arrived fresh and hot and made me happy. Granted I was super hungry at this point, but I know a good burger when I taste one!

One draw back- I ordered dessert. Carrot cake. It came frozen with falling off icing. No bueno. Would I order dessert from here again? Not sure. May take a risk. 

All in all, get yo' self some Roma!
author: Ana B.

description:
If I'm hungry at 7 pm or even 1:00 in the morning the first place that comes to my head, is Rome Pizza! The dish that I always like to ask, is New York steak, you can choose from rice, pasta or soup to accompany these delicious meat, sometimes I ask all the options, (rsrsrs) and for dessert, I also ordered a wonderful crepe strawberry and chocolate, just to remember that I already wanna to eat 
 Ps: this is also the place that has the fastest delivery, and service is always 100%!
author: Jessica S.

description:
I've been coming to Roma's for 15 years, at least. I'm not as thrown off by it's questionable exterior because, let's face it, SF-ers have seen worse. Let me start off first by telling you about their pizza, then I'd like to close out by telling you what happened to me last time I was here. It's just an example of what to expect in the Mission-Geneva on a Friday night.

Pizza: Crust is thick and soft, they really pile on the toppings (especially cheese), and their sauce tastes fresh made and not from a can. I always get the Roma Special because it has everything.  Their garlic cheesy breadsticks are BOMB and freshly baked. Their vegetables (bell pepper, mushrooms are not overcooked, which is a common mistake pizza places make. I had their hot wings once and I thought those were "meh" - I didn't like the sauce. So if you stick to pizza and breadsticks, you'll walk out with a happy tummy.

Oh yeah, and they also sell salads. But going to a pizzeria for salad is like going to a prostitute for a hug. So...yeah....

So last time I was here, my then-fiancee had to chase out a beligerent drunk guy who had wandered in to ramble on about Tiger Woods being a pimp. He got chased out and ran into a wall. Then the cops came and took him away for public intoxication. I realize that none of this is really relevant to the pizza itself, but if you're not from here, or if you're easily startled, then maybe you should avoid coming here at night. Just saying :)

But don't let that deter you. Roma's totally owns. They're a true SF original, even if they are a little rough around the edges.
author: Mariela D.

description:
If you like mediocre pizza that takes over an hour to be delivered, definitely order from this place. I made the mistake of ordering from Roma several times out of convenience and tonight was the straw that broke the camel's back.

Long story short, I placed an order for a pizza at 8:15PM. It arrived at my place, cold and mediocre as ever at 9:45pm. 1.5hrs? Seriously? 

To add insult to injury, I called them to complain and the guy said sorry and hung up on me as I was talking. 

I will never order from Roma, ever again.
author: Tae K.

description: I've ordered entres to be delivered twice from Roma, and the meals are fantastic. The first was their Cornish Game Hen with sides and soup, and next time I had Veal Parmesan.  The soup I had both times was their clam chowder which I really enjoyed. Fast and friendly service. I think this is my new spot.
author: Lavina L.

description:
Why five stars?  
Yum!
Yum!
Yum!
Give it a few tries because Roma is the best late night delivery ever!!!
;)
author: Karina P.

description: We tried delivery from a new pizza place this weekend and were pleasantly surprised. The food came quick and it was really good. The cheese was really creamy.
author: Chase L.

description: Their pizza is great. They are pretty much the only place that I will order deliver from. They are also on Eat24, so there are lots of great deals for coupons. It's free delivery, and they're open late, which is awesome because not much is in the Excelsior. Their delivery people always seem great, and I never have an issue. I probably order from them at least twice a month. I also commend their speedy delivery. I don't think I have ever waited longer than 45 minutes, which was to be expected on a Friday night, but majority of the time, they deliver in about 30 minutes. I've never had a face to face interaction with their brick and mortar location as I only order delivery, but everything past ordering, they make a seamless experience, and I've been loyally devoted. With exception to when they're closed, which has only happened once, they are the only place that I order from for pizza delivery.
author: dAvid s.

description: This pizza place has been around for ever even though it has changed owners a bazzillion time. The recipes don't change much. I love this place and when ever we visit the city the kids beg us to go to Roma's to eat..
author: Jennifer G.

description: Ordered the Roma special. Very tasty, fresh ingredients, by far better than Toto's in my opinion. Delivery was super fast! Pizza arrived hot and fresh! I would've given it 5 stars if it wasn't so pricy! But worth the price anyway...
author: Cesar B.

description: I've had pizza in New York, Jersey (Jonuzi's), Philly, Chicago (Malnatti's) and of course the Bay. BUT this is my FAVORITE pizza joint.  A neighborhood whole in the wall.  I first came here on a date as a teenager in "89" and it was love at first bite! They don't skimp on the toppings, yes it's floppy but that's the "Style" of pizza it is.  The sauce is properly seasoned (not too acidic).  And just to mention, I ordered linguine or fettuccine with clams in a white sauce... Off the hook! Better than Buco Di Peppos!     As for service, they were friendly the food was freshly made, so yes we had to wait a bit (but not not crazy long).   Good Ol'Skool pizza, made the way it was meant to be!
author: Gia A.

description: Avocado salad with Italian dressing isn't too shabby. The veg pizza was ok yet the dough wasn't that great. The service is ok, the bathrooms were clean, and the merlot was ok but not the best. He was ok and so was I. The plus side is the parking at midnight and the closing time on a Sunday Night.
author: R C.

description: Awesome Pizza!! Dont get the wrong idea if you go in there and there is not many people in the resturaunt. This is the way pizza was supposed to be made!!
author: Asheton D.

description: Hands down my favorite place to order online! Though delivery is a bit slower than I would want, the food is always hot and amazing. The linguini scampi, mango crepe, and ny steak is  PERFECT. I will continue to order from here as well as share it!
author: Carmen N.

description:
I don't like thick-crust pizza but even if I did, I would still call the crust on the pizza I had delivered last night "horrible!"  It was doughy, spongy (think Wonder bread), and flavorless.  The same goes for the pizza toppings:  insipid.

They delivered it fast but it was not very hot when it arrived.  In fact, I suspect that in order to get it out fast, they didn't even fully cook it.

I will never order from them again.
author: Troy H.

description: $3.75 for a small slice of cheese.  This place used to be good, now its a rip off.  There are loads of other options in the area.  explore them.
author: schmoo l.

description:
Service: 3/5
Food: 2/5
Wait: 4/5
Price: $$
Portions: 5/5
Presentation of food: 4/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3/5
Overall: 2/5

SO I ORDERED A SMALL PEPPERONI&MUSHROOM WITH AN ORDER OF BUFFALO WINGS. MY ORDER CAME ON TIME; NICE THEY THROW IN A COKE FOR MY ORDER BEING OVER $15. BUT APPARENTLY THEY MIXED UP MY ORDER WITH SOMEBODY ELSE'S ORDER. I WAS ORDER #5 AND THEY GAVE ME ORDER #6, THEY GAVE ME A PEPPERONI, MUSHROOM, SAUSAGE, AND ONIONS AND SPAGHETTI. FIRST I DIDNT TRIP OFF THE PIZZA; BUT THEN I LOOK INTO THE BOX TO SEE PASTA INSTEAD OF WINGS -_-* AND I WAS FEENING FOR THEIR WINGS; CUZ THEY HAVE THE BEST BUFFALO WINGS. MY ORIGINAL RATING WAS GOING TO BE 3 STARS, BUT AFTER THAT 2 STARS IS WHAT THEY DESERVE =T
author: Eva H.

description:
I've been meaning to review this place for a while.  I've eaten here on several occasions, usually late night because they are the least busiest out of the rest of the pizzerias around the place.  That means no long waits to get my pizza when I'm hungry, cold, and just want to get home.  Everytime I walk in or pass by Roma's it's always empty.  And let me tell you, there is good reason for the place to be empty.  I had a pizza delivered from there just last night in fact.

To start off, it took a long time for me to just get my order out because the guy couldn't speak english fluently.  So then he put another guy on the phone to better assist me.  After I took the pizza into my house I opened up the box and saw that they got my order wrong.  This was after the delivery boy left of course.  I figured that it was too much trouble to call Roma's again to fix my order so I just decided to deal with it. 

I picked up a slice and it fell apart.  The cheese fell off of the dough, leaving me with a cheese-less and topping-less, pile of goop.  This always happens with Roma pizza so I wasn't surprised.  I heard this place used to be good, but it went under new management and the place fell apart.   If you're looking for better pizza go to Little Joe's down the block.
author: Joyce C.

description: Great place to eat.  Food are excellent, never had a problem with them.  I'll keep on coming back. Delivery service are friendly and nice.
author: Frederick L.

description:
I must say, Awful.  The crust was thick and stale, frankly hard to chew. I asked for white sauce on the pizza and it tasted like bad milk, It had to of been just reheated after being in the freezer for a few years, thats how bad it was. I usually give places like this a second try, but I'm not sure if I could take it again. It was a struggle to give one star, it really deserves a half. Don't trust that menu on your door.

This was a delivery, I've yet to walk in the place.
author: Alex S.

description:
I personally didn't think this place was that great when I first had it but being that I've had it a lot more recently motivated me to change my mind about it.

I eat at the actual pizzeria and the people there are friendly and helpful.  The pizza is very appetizing and the ingredients are very fresh.  

One thing that I did notice was that although when I ate there, it was very good, when I had it for delivery just last week...there was a noticeable difference in the quality of the pizza.  

I know, I know that having pizza delivered is great and convenient but this place just might be worth the trip out if you're in the area to have the pizza.  Overall, I'd say that the prices are about right for a pizza place....usually my friends and I order an XL and it comes out to about $30 roughly along with a pitcher of beer that brings the total to about $40 which isn't bad. 

Good pizza...not the best but definitely tasty.
author: David B.

description:
My friends and i were stuck on Mission at 1:00AM, we were cold, tired, and hungry. everything else was closed, but we found Roma open. We ordered a large pizza with Sausage, Mushrooms, and Bacon. It was absolutely fantastic. the bacon was cooked to perfection, not overcooked and burnt, or undercooked and fatty. it came hot and melty and delicious. 
Roma seems to be getting bad reviews on here, but those reviews are not at all what i experienced. I will definitely go back to Roma, and if you are in the City late at night, Roma is open till 2AM, so i highly recommend you do to!
author: Olong J.

description: Late night delight! Oogey gooey cheese, like teenage mutant ninja turtle pizza status. I'm about it. Not some 5 star pizza but some good ass pizza none the less. Working man's pizza. Oh, and hella fast delivery. Ordering again here when I crave pizza in Excelsior
author: Ashley V.

description: Roma Pizza is my favorite place to eat!! It has everything that I love: pizza, calzone, crepe and pasta !! The place is clean. Everything taste delicious. People are friendly and polite. When I asked for delivery it was just on time !! I love it !!!!
author: Ludmylla C.

description: An absolutely giant slice of pizza for $3.00.  On the thin side with a very high cheese to sauce ratio and very generous with the cheese.  Crust is a bit soggy but I thoroughly enjoyed it.  It's a restaurant with wine and beer.  Plenty of tables to sit.
author: Jeff J.

description: I'm always on a hunger strike I swear :)) Such a fatty but hey, it's good for yelp users right? lol Anywhoooo, I decided it'd be a good idea to order a pizza at 12:30pm last night. City boy suggests Roma's so we hit 'em up and say hey how much is a 2 topping medium pizza? $18!!!! WHAT?!! HELL NO! So we say how much is a Large and can you throw in something else??? $21.75 for a large and 3 sodas :| Now why the hell is a medium and 2 sodas $18?!?!?!? Yeah WTF guys, not impressed with your prices but your pizza is pretty damn good, especially the cheese. Maybe I'll hit ya'll again for a large but definitely NOT a medium.
author: Nancy R.

description: Decent pizza, but the sauce is just a bit too sweet for me. When it comes to pizza, I'd take Bravo's any day, but unfortunately they're a cash only joint. When it's rainy and I have zero cash, Roma accepts credit cards and so they get my business. I have yet to try their other foods, but they have everything from fish and chips to salads to sandwiches, so I'm happy to see that you can get some healthier alternatives delivered as well.
author: Sierra S.

description: Sadly, Roma changed hands and went downhill a few months back. The Spanish-style green sauce pizza is not very good (runny and just not very flavorful), and the regular pies just aren't what they used to be.
