They do serve breakfast here now, but I haven't tried it (the breakfast menu looked pretty basic).
author: Brian H.

description: If you aren't too picky about your pizza and opt out of Little Joe's and Bravo's, Roma is probably the last place to order from in area.  I've ordered pizza here for a long time and I would have to rate the pizza as just standard.  If you crave for it  and don't expect anything special in your pies, Roma is the place to order from.  We usually get an XL pepperoni which can feed about 5 people easy.  It will cost you about $25 with free sodas.  The wait is 45 to an hour.  The last time I ordered here the delivery guy got lost and I got my pie soggy and lukewarm.  On top of that, the guy on the phone said everything would cost $26.50 but I was charged $31.80 on my credit card?!??!!  I will have to second guess this place the next time.  Maybe I will just opt for Little Ceasar's that just opened around the corner.
author: Chris S.

description: I use to love this place. Now, I despise it. It all started when they changed owners. I remember ordering a pizza for pickup. I got there in 20 minutes and they said it wasn't ready because they dropped my pizza and they showed me the one they dropped. OK... 10 minutes later, they take it out and they ALMOST drop it again! I come home and the pizza wasn't that great. The last straw was when I ordered delivery. The first time, it took 1 1/2 hours for the pizza to come. The second and very last time I ordered from them, it took 2 FU*KIN HOURS.  BULLSH*T!
author: Conrad C.

description: We ordered a BBQ chicken Pizza with BBQ sauce. I was kinda annoyed that they actually charge you as a topping for any sauce other than tomato, (interesting how the menu doesn't say that) Our pizza was poorly put together with the sauce on the bottom and cheese then then pieces of grilled chicken with no flavor sparsely floating on the top. If you ask me it should have went; cheese, BBQ chicken and drizzled with BBQ sauce. The sandwich was pretty decent and much more worth while than the pizza. Over all this place does the trick for a late night snack but not if you want some super good pizza.
author: Lani R.

description:
they have some pretty tasty lasagna 
mmm

it's a small place so i always took the orders to go or for pickup
author: charlotte s.

description:
2 HOURS! Seriously 2 hours for delivery on a Wed. night. I have never written a review before I get my food, but now they are not even answering their phone.

Yelp should have 0 star rating for this type of service.

AVOID!
author: Alex K.

description: Even though they act like I'm crazy every time I order it, they have the best broccoli and garlic pizza in my neighborhood.  And on most nights they had the pizza maker must have...the thick black mustache.
author: Katie H.

description: A great reliable place for deliveries. Plus they have wine!
author: Fiuwriter C.

description:
Horrible quality. I got their flier on my door knob and figured I would give them a shot. Well, never again. The pizza fell apart when I picked it up. The crust was stale.. almost like they had premade it the day before and heated it up. Thank god it was a veggie pizza. I would been been afraid for my life if it had meat on it. 
Horrible pizza. Disgusting. Don't waste your money.
author: Ronnie M.

description: Shamefully bad pie, but it shouldn't have come as a surprise because the shabby decor, torn up seats and horrible disorganization going on with the delivery drivers and management should've been an indication. The head pizza guy in charge didn't want to indulge us by slapping out a freshly made pie---we wouldn't have minded the wait--he just wanted to lazily re-heat some stale looking slices. And with us being just a bunch of equally lazy dudes looking to scarf down some carbs before liquid carbing ourselves, we went ahead with that idea thinking it couldn't have been THAT bad. Some choice words to describe THIS particular pizza: cardboard, coagulated cheese (even AFTER being nearly over-re-heated--yikes), sauce-less, shriveled up toppings, almost nothing redeeming. and YES, it was decidely worse than Domino's, the standard for low-end pizza. Probably the 2nd worst pizza behind Zorba's in San Mateo, and you can read my scathing review of that place, too.
author: Chris C.

description: well, i dunno.  i personally don't like it when the cheese on my pizza hardens within the first 5 minutes out of the oven.  maybe that's just me.
author: Zoe L.
